elements.text:
You're working on a report with a few colleagues and need to report some statistics. A colleague suggests that you change the statistics so that your report looks better, but that would be lying.

Here are some behaviors that someone might do at that moment or in the future:

texts: I change our results because I'm not confident in our work.
I want to change our results to finish the presentation more quickly, but instead I keep trying to work with what we have.
I am tempted to change our results, but decide not to.
I suggest putting together the presentation without changing the results.
I am enthusiastic about finding ways to present our findings clearly and effectively.
